column1: When a bull wants to listen to a cassette what does he put on his head? steer phones!
column3: A steer is a castrated male bovine, commonly raised for beef.
column4: The farmer decided to sell the steer at the market for a good price.
column5: The steer was always calm and easy to manage on the ranch.

column1: Did you hear about the guy who robbed blind people? nobody saw it coming.
column3: Nobody refers to no person or no one.
column4: Nobody in the room felt like speaking up about the unfair treatment.
column5: Nobody was surprised when the announcement was made.

column1: Kim jong-un has promised a new clear future for north korea. oops! spelt nuclear wrong.
column3: Nuclear pertains to the nucleus of an atom, often related to energy or weapons.
column4: The country is focusing on developing nuclear energy as a clean power source.
column5: The scientist presented a paper on nuclear fusion at the international conference.

column1: I lost my thesaurus when I was little... i couldnt find the words to describe how I felt.
column3: A thesaurus is a reference book or resource for finding synonyms and antonyms.
column4: She consulted a thesaurus to find the perfect synonym for her essay.
column5: The writer always kept a thesaurus handy for expanding his vocabulary.
